title: The Uncomfortable Truth: A 3X Founder's Guide to Intellectual Honesty
excerpt: Crossbeam CEO and co-founder Bob Moore shares his tools for quashing biases in pursuit of the truth at every stage of company building.
highlights:

Highlight:There’s a common startup refrain that encourages aspiring founders to “fall in love with the problem.”

Highlight:With founders, I wasn’t asking, ‘Would you buy this?’ But instead, ‘Would you start this company? And what are the things that you think you might bump into?’

title: GitHub - kuchin/awesome-cto: A curated and opinionated list of resources fo
excerpt: A curated and opinionated list of resources for Chief Technology Officers, with the emphasis on startups - kuchin/awesome-cto

title: Startup Best Practices 1 - Situational Management by @ttunguz
excerpt: In response to yesterday’s post on management design patterns, many readers asked for examples of best practices. So I’m going to write about the management best practices I have been taught and I have observed in startups. This is the first post of that series. The first management technique is called Situational Management, one that my wife, a terrific manager at Google, taught me. A manager’s most important function in a startup is to motivate employees to accomplish the business’s goal.

title: The Highest Paid Person's Opinion
excerpt: Every company makes decisions based on the highest paid person's opinion. It turns out it's just a hypothesis. Here's how to tame it.

title: ‘Give away your Legos’ and other commandments for scaling startups
excerpt: Molly Graham helped forge a work culture at Facebook that's withstood huge amounts of growth. Today, she's something of a rapid scaling expert. Here's the key to doing it right, she says.

title: What leader(s) over your product career truly changed how you approach prod
excerpt: I learned from bosses & peers, including some famous peeps like Reed Hastings, Patty McCord, and Dan Rosensweig. But mainly I learned by doing, supercharged by feedback from many "Friends of Gib."

title: CEO interview series: Michael Seibel on leadership attributes in successful startup leaders
excerpt: Explore a glimpse into how M. Seibel thinks about leadership attributes and some contrarian views that may be at the heart of how he picks great companies.
